tiles.name: Icy Ledge
tiles.description: A treacherous icy ledge overlooking a glacial stream. Prayer flags flutter in the wind. Part of the mountain path leading to the Kyzyl-Suu Monastery.

tiles.name: Snowy Slope
tiles.description: A steep, snow-covered slope. Sparse vegetation clings to the rock beneath. High avalanche risk.

tiles.name: Glacial Stream Source
tiles.description: The origin of a glacial stream, fed by melting ice. A small patch of rock is exposed nearby.

tiles.name: Stone Pathway
tiles.description: A stone pathway leading towards the Central Prayer Wheel. The path is worn smooth by centuries of use.

tiles.name: Central Prayer Wheel
tiles.description: The heart of the Kyzyl-Suu Monastery. A massive, ornate prayer wheel constantly spun by monks. The center of spiritual activity.

tiles.name: Yak Hide Shelter
tiles.description: A simple shelter constructed from stone and yak hides, providing refuge from the harsh alpine climate. Used for storage and rest.

tiles.name: Rocky Outcrop
tiles.description: A rocky outcrop providing a vantage point over the valley. A few scattered prayer flags mark the spot.

tiles.name: Stone House
tiles.description: A typical stone house in the village, built into the side of the mountain. Smoke rises from the chimney, indicating a fire within.

tiles.name: Glacial Stream Crossing
tiles.description: A precarious crossing point over a fast-flowing glacial stream. Icy rocks provide a slippery foothold.
